repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
the "LSP client defaults" refers to buffer-local defaults for lsp-active buffers.

`gr` is global, and it appears that `v_an` / `v_in` are also global.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -171,6 +163,15 @@ you never want any default mappings, call |:mapclear| early in your config.
 - |[<Space>|, |]<Space>|
 - Nvim LSP client defaults |lsp-defaults|
   - K |K-lsp-default|
+  - |v_an|, |v_in|
+  - |gO|
+  - gr prefix |gr-default|

comment_data.body:
It's not obvious to me why "LSP client defaults" refers to buffer-local, but if it does, then the tag lsp-defaults is misleading, because it points to a section covering both global and buffer-local defaults.
In this case, is dividing by buffer-locality more important than by LSP semantics?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -171,6 +163,15 @@ you never want any default mappings, call |:mapclear| early in your config.
 - |[<Space>|, |]<Space>|
 - Nvim LSP client defaults |lsp-defaults|
   - K |K-lsp-default|
+  - |v_an|, |v_in|
+  - |gO|
+  - gr prefix |gr-default|

@@ -171,6 +163,15 @@ you never want any default mappings, call |:mapclear| early in your config.
 - |[<Space>|, |]<Space>|
 - Nvim LSP client defaults |lsp-defaults|

comment_data.body: gO is definitely not lsp-specific. idk why it was listed under "gr prefix"
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -171,6 +163,15 @@ you never want any default mappings, call |:mapclear| early in your config.
 - |[<Space>|, |]<Space>|
 - Nvim LSP client defaults |lsp-defaults|
   - K |K-lsp-default|
+  - |v_an|, |v_in|
+  - |gO|

comment_data.body: let's put these on 1 line, space-separated, no comma, alpha sorted
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -169,8 +162,16 @@ you never want any default mappings, call |:mapclear| early in your config.
 - |[a|, |]a|, |[A|, |]A|
 - |[b|, |]b|, |[B|, |]B|
 - |[<Space>|, |]<Space>|
-- Nvim LSP client defaults |lsp-defaults|
+- LSP defaults |lsp-defaults|
   - K |K-lsp-default|
+  - |v_an|, |v_in|
+  - gr prefix |gr-default|
+    - |grn|
+    - |gra|
+    - |grr|
+    - |gri|
+    - |grt|

comment_data.body:
These are intended for non-lsp usage also but can leave it here for now.

```suggestion
  - |v_an| |v_in|
```

comment_data.body:
we use commas for other entries, such as `- |[b|, |]b|, |[B|, |]B|`

And space as delimiter between title and helptag, I think it makes sense to keep that?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -169,8 +162,16 @@ you never want any default mappings, call |:mapclear| early in your config.
 - |[a|, |]a|, |[A|, |]A|
 - |[b|, |]b|, |[B|, |]B|

-- Nvim LSP client defaults |lsp-defaults|

comment_data.body:
I don't want to lose the gr-default tag, but this feels a bit awkward.
```
  - gr prefix |gr-default|
    - |gra| |gri| |grn| |grr| |grt|
```

For the ordering, I was referring to the order in lsp.txt. We should probably update it there as well.
